title: Curfew and violence in Gujarat deters traveling - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Curfew and violence in Gujarat deters traveling Published on : Wednesday, August 26, 2015
The domestic unrest in Gujarat, a western state of India following agitations over a job reservation policy is affecting the travelers to and from Gujarat heavily.
According to sources, protesters even attacked security personnel overnight with stones and sticks and set fire on private and government vehicles. Curfew is imposed in various areas of the state and travelers are requested to avoid such areas.
The Centre sent 5,000 paramilitary forces to Gujarat after the overnight violence hit the state. After the violence on Tuesday, protesters have called for a state-wide strike and incidents of violence are still reported in various parts of Gujarat.
In Ahmedabad, 9 police station areas are under curfew. Two killed in police firing in Gadh area of Palanpur. Mobile internet services in Vadodara to remain suspended for 24 hours, beginning 6 am Wednesday morning, to prevent spread of rumors.
There is plenty of tensions in major cities of Ahmedabad, Surat, Rajkot and in North Gujarat region. Although, there are no reports of cancellation or delay of flights and railways to and from Gujarat, travelers are requested to avoid tension zones for safety and security.
